Detailed Description

cvmx_bgx::_smu::_rx_decision

This register specifies the byte count used to determine when to accept or to filter a packet. As each byte in a packet is received by BGX, the L2 byte count (i.e. the number of bytes from the beginning of the L2 header (DMAC)) is compared against CNT. In normal operation, the L2 header begins after the PREAMBLE + SFD (BGX()_SMU()_RX_FRM_CTL[PRE_CHK] = 1) and any optional UDD skip data (BGX()_SMU()_RX_UDD_SKP[LEN]).
